definition: county head magistrate (old)
to know/to be aware
county
Aichi prefecture, central Japan

sentences.english: It also promoted the World Expo 2010 at the World Expo in Aichi , Japan.
sentences.chinese: 它也促進了在日本愛知縣世博會2010年世博會。

sentences.english: Toyohashi City, Aichi Prefecture, Japan TFM Choir Guest Conductor.
sentences.chinese: 日本國愛知縣豐橋市TFM合唱團客席指揮。

sentences.english: A single local magistrate combines functions which ought to be distributed among at least six different officers.
sentences.chinese: 一個知縣的職責，至少應該分給六個不同的官員。

sentences.english: As they withdrew their hands Chen would examine them.
sentences.chinese: 同時，知縣在他們摸完後也查看了他們的手。

sentences.english: After lighting incense and chanting prayers, the magistrate had curtains erected around the bell.
sentences.chinese: 焚香誦經後，知縣用一塊布簾將鍾擋了起來。

graduate/successful candidate in the imperial provincial examination
inspector-general of province in Ming and Qing times
candidate for the Imperial Examination proposed by a tributary state
Jiaqing Emperor (1760-1820), seventh Qing emperor, personal name 顒琰|颙琰[Yong2 yan3], reigned 1796-1820
Ministry of (Confucian) Rites (in imperial China)
reign name of second Qing emperor (1644-1662)
reign name of penultimate Qing emperor Guangxu or Guang-hsu (1875-1908)
Chongzhen, reign name of last Ming emperor (1628-1644)
reign name of Ming emperor (1573-1619)
to compile and edit
Yin county in Zhejiang
reign name of Qing emperor (1850-1861)/Xianfeng county in Enshi Tujia and Miao autonomous prefecture 恩施土家族苗族自治州[En1 shi1 Tu3 jia1 zu2 Miao2 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Hubei
high official/government minister
